000_prologue.title: Prologue
000_prologue.narr_text: I woke to the taste of iron and ash, my breath rattling in my chest like a dying man's last whisper.

1.text: Continue.

000_prologue_c1.narr_text: The world around me was a blur—towering trees that seemed to mock me with their unyielding strength, a canopy of stars that offered no solace.

1.text: Focus on my name.

2.text: Take in the surroundings.

000_prologue_2.narr_text: My name is Lyaris Alaric Talbot... I think. I hold onto the name like a fraying thread, tugging at it to keep myself tethered.

1.text: Continue

000_prologue_2_c1.narr_text: Who am I? What am I doing here? The answers slip through my grasp, my thoughts scattered like leaves in the wind.

1.text: Try to remember more.

000_prologue_3.narr_text: The forest looms around me, ancient and unyielding. Towering trees stretch into the heavens, their branches clawing at the sky.

1.text: Focus on my name.

000_prologue_3_c1.narr_text: The air is thick with the scent of earth and decay. Somewhere in the distance, a howl shatters the silence, sending a chill down my spine.

1.text: Focus on my name.

2.text: Think about what happened to me.

000_prologue_4.narr_text: Images flash in my mind—a contract signed with trembling hands, promises of gold whispered in shadowed halls, and the sharp, cruel laughter of betrayal. I remember faces, not names, and the sensation of cold steel slicing through my trust.

1.text: Continue

000_prologue_4_c1.narr_text: They left me here, stripped of everything, abandoned to the merciless wilderness.

1.text: Examine my body for injuries.

000_prologue_5.title: Prologue: The Mark
000_prologue_5.narr_text: Pain courses through me, sharper and more unforgiving than any punishment I’ve endured in my master’s lessons.

1.text: Continue

000_prologue_5_c1.narr_text: It’s as if I were being struck by the lightning of his magic tenfold, but this agony doesn’t fade—it clings and burns.

1.text: Continue

000_prologue_5_c2.narr_text: Beneath my skin, an unbearable heat writhes, sharp and unyielding, as though molten iron flows through my veins.

1.text: Continue

000_prologue_5_c3.narr_text: My hand quivers as I lift it, and there it is—a mark carved into my flesh, faintly glowing with a power not of this world. It thrums like a curse, unnatural and terrible, a force I cannot name but feel with every nerve. It’s a living thing, lurking just beneath the surface, waiting.

1.text: Panic and try to suppress it.

2.text: Accept the mark and move on.

000_prologue_6.narr_text: I grip my wrist tightly, as if I could hold the chaos in place. My breathing quickens, the glow intensifying for a moment before it settles. This mark... it saved me, didn’t it? I should be dead, but I’m not. Not yet.

1.text: Move forward cautiously.

001_intro.narr_text: The forest is alive with sounds—howls that pierce the night, rustling leaves that hint at unseen predators. I stagger to my feet, my body screaming in protest. I have nothing but my will and this cursed mark. Somewhere in the distance, I see the faint glow of torches. A village, perhaps? Or bandits. Either way, it’s a chance I have to take.

1.text: Head toward the lights, hoping for sanctuary.

2.text: Avoid the lights and try to scavenge in the wilderness.

001_wandering_1.narr_text: The ground crunches underfoot, the sound unnaturally loud in the oppressive silence. Each step feels like a question I can't answer. My memories flicker like distant lanterns—there, but too far to grasp. I push forward, guided by nothing but the hope that movement itself will lead me somewhere.

1.text: Turn to the left and continue walking.

2.text: Stay on the same path and move forward.

001_wandering_2.title: W
001_wandering_2.narr_text: The trees feel closer now, their ancient bark like gnarled faces frozen in silent judgment. My name echoes in my mind—Lyaris Alaric Talbot.

1.text: Continue

001_wandering_2_c1.narr_text: I repeat it under my breath as though it might anchor me. I was a mercenary. No... more than that. A soldier? A sellsword? Images blur together—fights won, scars earned, faces forgotten.

1.text: Take a sharp right and keep walking.

2.text: Continue straight, letting instinct guide you.

001_wandering_3.title: Wandering: The Forest Speaks
001_wandering_3.narr_text: A distant howl cuts through the night, sending a shiver up my spine. The air smells damp and earthy, with a faint metallic tang I can't place. My hand unconsciously brushes the mark on my wrist. It's warm to the touch, a steady reminder that I am... different now. The memories of betrayal surface again, unbidden. I trusted someone once. I was loyal. And they left me here to die.

1.text: Pause to listen, then move toward the noise.

2.text: Veer away from the noise, walking into darker terrain.

001_wandering_4.title: Wandering: The Endless Forest
001_wandering_4.narr_text: The darkness feels alive, the forest pressing in on all sides. I catch glimpses of movement in the corner of my eye, but when I turn, there’s nothing there. My breath is steady, but my mind races. Who am I really? The answer lies somewhere in the void of my memory. Each step feels heavier, as though the weight of the question is sinking me into the earth itself.

1.text: Check your belongings for anything useful.

2.text: Continue walking aimlessly, hoping for direction.

001_remembers_map.title: Wandering: The Map
001_remembers_map.narr_text: My fingers fumble in my pockets until they close around something smooth and folded. A map. Relief washes over me as I pull it out, though the paper is crumpled and smudged with dirt. The markings are faint, but they show landmarks—the forest, a river, and a settlement not too far from here. My heart quickens. This map might just be my lifeline.

1.text: Head toward the settlement.

2.text: Follow the river instead.

001_wolf_attack.title: An Unexpected Threat
001_wolf_attack.narr_text:
As you move through the forest, your senses prickle with unease. The hair on the back of your neck stands on end as a rustling sound cuts through the otherwise quiet night. Then it happens—a shadow bursts from your right flank, teeth bared and eyes glowing with feral intensity. A wolf. It lunges for your side, jaws snapping.

You barely manage to twist out of the way, the beast's claws grazing your cloak. Your mind races. You can feel the mark on your wrist pulsing faintly. You know you have the power to summon fire, but at a cost. Alternatively, you could rely on your agility and the dagger you feel strapped to your thigh.

The wolf snarls and prepares for another strike, circling you like a predator savoring its prey. What will you do?

1.text: Draw power from the mark to summon a fireball and incinerate the wolf.

2.text: Rely on your agility and try to find a weakness to exploit with your dagger.

002_draw_power.title: Fire and Fury
002_draw_power.narr_text:
You raise your hand instinctively, the mark flaring to life as heat rushes through your veins. The sensation is overwhelming, like molten iron coursing through your body. A fireball forms in your palm, its light illuminating the wolf's hungry eyes. Without hesitation, you hurl it forward.

The spell hits the wolf square in the chest, igniting its fur in a burst of flame. The creature lets out a pained howl before collapsing in a smoking heap. The forest grows quiet once more, the acrid scent of burnt fur lingering in the air. You feel drained but alive.

Your victory is short-lived, as the exhaustion from channeling the mark’s power starts to creep in.

1.text: Catch your breath and scan the area for other threats.

002_physical_confrontation.title: The Harder Way
002_physical_confrontation.narr_text:
Your fingers twitch toward the dagger at your side as the wolf lunges again. You sidestep just in time, the beast’s jaws snapping shut on empty air. With a practiced motion, you draw the blade and pivot, aiming for the wolf’s exposed flank.

Your first strike grazes the creature, drawing blood but not enough to deter it. The wolf spins with frightening speed, teeth flashing dangerously close to your leg. You need to end this quickly.

1.text: Use the mark’s power despite the risk to finish the fight.

2.text: Dodge again and aim for a killing strike with your dagger.

003_archer_appearance.title: An Unexpected Ally
003_archer_appearance.narr_text:
Before you can react, the wolf crouches low, readying itself for another lunge. Time slows as you prepare for the inevitable. Then, the sharp twang of a bowstring cuts through the tension. An arrow flies through the air and buries itself into the wolf’s skull with perfect precision. The beast collapses instantly, lifeless.

You turn your head and see her. A woman steps out of the shadows, bow in hand and a small, amused smile on her face. Her features are sharp yet friendly, her confident stride betraying her skill. 'You looked like you could use a hand,' she says casually, lowering her bow.

Relief floods through you, the adrenaline finally fading. You open your mouth to speak, but exhaustion catches up to you. The last thing you see is her rushing toward you as your vision fades to black.

1.text: Pass out from exhaustion.

004_waking_in_inn.title: A Strange Awakening
004_waking_in_inn.narr_text:
You wake to the gentle creak of wooden beams and the faint smell of stew wafting through the air. A soft bed cradles your aching body, a stark contrast to the harsh forest floor. The woman from before is seated across the room, idly polishing her bow.

She notices you stirring and offers a smile. 'Glad to see you're alive,' she says. 'You’ve got some explaining to do, though.'

Her words are light, but her eyes are sharp, assessing you. You realize your mark is still hidden, for now. The question is, how much do you tell her?

1.text: Thank her and share some of your story.

2.text: Remain cautious and share as little as possible.

004_conversation.title: A Tense Exchange
004_conversation.narr_text:
The archer leans forward, resting her elbows on her knees as she studies you. 'So, you’re not just some lost traveler, are you?' she says, her tone light but her eyes sharp. 'That mark of yours... it’s not something you see every day.'

Your hand instinctively brushes over the faint glow on your wrist, now barely visible under your sleeve. She caught a glimpse, then. You’ll need to tread carefully.

'What’s your name?' she asks, tilting her head. 'And why were you wandering alone in a place crawling with wolves?'

You can feel the weight of her curiosity, but also the undercurrent of caution. She doesn’t fully trust you yet, but she’s willing to listen.

1.text: Tell her your name and part of the truth about your journey.

2.text: Deflect her question and ask who she is instead.

3.text: Stay silent and observe her reaction.

005_partial_truth.title: A Fragile Alliance
005_partial_truth.narr_text:
'My name is Lyaris,' you begin cautiously. 'I’ve been... searching for answers. That mark you saw—it’s tied to something I don’t fully understand yet.'

Her gaze softens slightly. 'Answers, huh? Sounds like a dangerous kind of journey. You’re lucky I found you when I did.'

She leans back, crossing her arms. 'Name’s Kaela, by the way. And you’re not the only one with secrets. Let’s just say helping you wasn’t entirely selfless.'

Her cryptic comment leaves you with more questions than answers. Before you can press her, she stands. 'We should talk more, but first, you need to eat. Rest up. We’ll need to move soon.'

1.text: Thank her and agree to rest.

2.text: Ask what she meant by ‘not entirely selfless.’

005_deflect.title: Turning the Tables
005_deflect.narr_text:
'Who I am isn’t the important question right now,' you say, your tone even. 'The real question is: who are you? And why were you in the forest with a bow at the ready?'

Kaela raises an eyebrow, a faint smile playing on her lips. 'Fair enough. My name’s Kaela, and let’s just say the forest is my home turf. As for why I was there... let’s just say I had business nearby. Lucky for you, I have good aim.'

She stands, stretching her arms over her head. 'Now, if you’re done interrogating me, maybe we can talk about how to get you out of this mess alive.'

1.text: Stay silent.

2.text: Think about a response.

005_silence.title: Measured Silence
005_silence.narr_text:
You say nothing, your gaze steady as you study her. The silence stretches, but Kaela doesn’t seem perturbed. Instead, she smirks and sits back, crossing one leg over the other.

'Not much of a talker, huh?' she says, her tone teasing. 'That’s fine. Actions speak louder, anyway.'

She stands, her movements fluid and deliberate. 'You’ve got secrets. I’ve got mine. Maybe we’ll get along after all.' Her words carry a hint of amusement, but her eyes stay watchful. This woman is clearly used to danger.

1.text: Nod and let her take the lead.

2.text: Ask her about her plans for the journey ahead.

006_preparing_to_leave.title: A New Path
006_preparing_to_leave.narr_text:
Kaela hands you a small bundle of supplies and gestures toward the door. 'You’ve got a lot to learn if you’re going to survive out here. But first, we need to get moving. Staying in one place too long isn’t safe.'

You glance at the mark on your wrist, feeling its faint warmth. There’s no telling what dangers lie ahead, but for now, you have an ally. Kaela’s confidence is reassuring, though her motives remain unclear.

The journey continues, with more questions than answers.

1.text: Follow Kaela and ask her about her knowledge of the region.

2.text: Stay quiet and focus on the path ahead.

006_selfless_motives.title: Hidden Motives
006_selfless_motives.narr_text:
'Not entirely selfless?' you ask, narrowing your eyes.

Kaela pauses, her gaze sharpening. 'Let’s just say I’m not the kind of person to help out of the goodness of my heart. You’ve got something that might interest me. That mark of yours—it’s rare. Dangerous, too. And it’s drawn attention you’re probably not ready for.'

Her words send a chill down your spine. She knows more than she’s letting on, but for now, she seems willing to keep you alive. The question is, at what cost?

1.text: Demand to know what she wants.

2.text: Agree to hear her out later and focus on moving forward.

007_new_allies.title: Into the Forest
007_new_allies.narr_text:
Kaela leads the way out of the inn, the late morning sunlight filtering through the tall trees overhead. The forest is dense but beautiful, the air fresh and the earth beneath your feet soft. You notice the occasional glint of light off her armor and the way she moves—careful, yet confident, with a practiced grace. Her dark hair, tied back in a loose ponytail, flutters slightly in the breeze, and her green eyes scan the surroundings, always alert.

You can feel her gaze occasionally flicking to you, not in an overtly obvious way, but enough that you can tell she’s curious. Her expression is calm, but there’s an underlying intensity about her. It’s clear she’s seen more than her fair share of danger. She’s not just any adventurer.

'You’re not from around here, are you?' she says after a moment, glancing over her shoulder. 'Terran, right? You don’t look like the kind who wanders too deep into foreign lands. I’d be surprised if you made it out of here alive on your own.' She smirks lightly, but there’s a tinge of genuine concern in her voice.

'Why are you so far from home?'

1.text: Explain that you’re searching for something important.

2.text: Ask about her interest in Terrans and why she thinks you’re so different.

3.text: Change the topic and ask her more about her monster-hunting work.

4.text: Stay quiet and let her continue guiding the way.

008_partial_explanation.title: A Shared Journey
008_partial_explanation.narr_text:
You take a deep breath, choosing your words carefully. 'I’m searching for something—something that might help me understand... who I really am.'

Kaela glances back, her green eyes narrowing slightly, but there’s no judgment in her gaze. She seems to understand more than she lets on. 'You don’t have to tell me everything,' she says softly, 'But I’ve been around long enough to know that people rarely travel this far for nothing.'

Her pace slows slightly as you both continue walking. The soft rustle of leaves underfoot and the distant calls of birds create an oddly peaceful atmosphere despite the forest’s danger.

'What is it like back home for you?' she asks suddenly. 'Is it so different from here?' Her voice has a gentle curiosity, and her expression softens as she listens for your response.

1.text: Tell her more about your homeland, what makes it unique.

2.text: Vaguely describe your homeland, staying cryptic.

3.text: Ask her about her previous hunts and the monsters she’s faced.

4.text: Remain silent and let her fill in the conversation.

008_kaela_interest.title: A Curious Bond
008_kaela_interest.narr_text:
'Terrans don’t come this far. Not many make it past the border,' Kaela says with a thoughtful frown. 'And you don’t seem like the type to just wander without reason.'

She looks at you for a long moment, her gaze intense yet not unkind. 'I’ve met a few of your kind in the past. Adventurers, explorers... they don’t usually last long. But you seem different. I can’t quite place it.'

She pauses, letting her words sink in before adding, 'Maybe it’s that look in your eyes. The same one I had when I first ventured out of my country, seeking... something.'

She smirks lightly, glancing away. 'But you can’t expect me to believe you’re just wandering around aimlessly, can you?'

1.text: Tell her that you’re searching for answers, just like her.

2.text: Admit that you’re lost, trying to find your way.

3.text: Ask her about her past as a monster hunter.

4.text: Change the topic and ask about the monsters around here.

death_page.title: The Hunter's Path
death_page.narr_text:
'Monster hunting isn’t as glamorous as it sounds,' Kaela says with a soft chuckle. 'It’s not all glory and bounty. Most of the time, it’s just tracking down creatures that would rather eat you than look at you.'

She pauses for a moment, clearly remembering some past hunts. 'I’ve fought beasts that could tear a man in half with one swipe. And I’ve learned to respect the forest. There’s more here than just trees.'

She takes a deep breath, then glances over at you. 'But you probably want to know what kind of monsters are lurking around here, don’t you?'

1.text: Ask about the most dangerous creatures she’s encountered.

2.text: Inquire about how she hunts monsters, the tools she uses.

3.text: Change the topic and ask her what brought her to this forest.

4.text: Stay quiet and listen to her recount her experiences.

008_silence.title: Unspoken Bonds
008_silence.narr_text:
The conversation dwindles into silence, but it’s not uncomfortable. Kaela seems content to walk side by side with you, occasionally glancing at you as if studying your expression.

The forest around you remains quiet, save for the occasional rustle of branches or distant animal calls. The trees here are older, their trunks thick with age, and the moss that carpets the ground gives off a damp, earthy scent.

Kaela doesn’t speak at first, but you can feel her curiosity lingering. Her eyes, dark as night with a subtle gleam of green, flick back to you occasionally.

Finally, she speaks softly. 'You know, Terrans don’t venture this far into others’ lands. It’s dangerous.' She smiles lightly. 'But you don’t seem like the kind to back down easily, do you?'

1.text: Confess that you're a little out of your depth, but you can handle it.

2.text: Ask her to tell you more about the forest and its dangers.

3.text: Admit you're still figuring things out and ask for her guidance.

4.text: Stay silent and focus on the path ahead.
